description.narrative: 1. Increase access to quality healthcare services. The Project will support an established healthcare service provider to move down-market to frontier provinces, to reach middle- and lower-income households, providing affordable basic radiotherapy services that are not readily available to those populations. 2. Enable knowledge transfer. Successful operation of the Proton Beam, one of the most advanced technologues in radiotherapy, would enable knowledge transfer amongst radiotherapy practitioners both within and outside the Company 3. Demonstration effect. This will be achieved in terms of improving standards and corporate governance in healthcare management, and in sending a positive message to other private sector investors about potential market opportunities in the healthcare sector. 4. Promoting health care reform and the public private partnership model. Concord''s success should help to enhance China''s health authorities'' confidence in private health care providers and increase willingness to further relax the regulatory barriers for private investment in the sector. 5. Create skilled employment opportunities. The Project will provide training and create employment opportunities for a number of specialty healthcare positions, including those of radiologists, which are currently in short supply in China.

Concord Medical Services Holdings Limited (Concord or the Company), which is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, has 133 centers located in 52 cities across 25 provinces. The Company operates the largest network of radiotherapy and diagnostic imaging centers in China. The Company also acquired a 52% interest in Changan Hospital, a private hospital in Xian, Shaanxi province, in the second quarter of 2012. Over the next three years, Concord will further expand its network by opening 50 new oncology and diagnostic centers, invest in a proton center in Beijing, and invest in an oncology hospital in Guangzhou (together, the Project).
